Artists 2019
Nora Renaud
NORARENAUD_HYPERANALOGIST Nora Renaud, (Geneva 1977), is a swiss artist that lives and works in Colombia. He works relates closely with fashion, free anthropology (net anthropology) and social networks. Her practice connects rituals such as “ancestral like”and“emojis_addict”¬ or “audios_mania” “attitudes”from isolated communities of the “worldwide web” and the ephimeral groups of social networks : unknown people or profiles collected online. She works manually and digitally anachronical handcrafted objects and folkloric artefacts using internet symbols and icons or emojis such as #, <3, the sharing symbol, :): :(:, @ etc..) She also paints over an hibrid reality using analog and digital filters to create a contradictory ersthetics shared under the hashtag #filespaintings and printed on soft interior design fabrics. Her recent works are focusing on identity and anthropology within a global and hyperconnected system. Therefore she uses the swiss passport, the iconic design of the swiss flag and the costumes of the swiss guard in roman Vatican to perform the most “successfull” disorders of our times: bipolarity, depression, ocd, …incarnated by allegorical avatars characters (Litio & quietapina) that promote the end of the internet and the archeology of the actual stereotypes that surround humanity, hashtag #DIAGNOSISISCARNAVAL From the spiral of her whole work there is an infinite weaving that ramificates in a big number of hashtags converted into rituals and mantras directly on her Instagram account : norarenaud_hyperanalogist, wher appear in loop visual works and narrations that present themselves as cyclic forms, a language that is the fruit of our collaboration between our“ smart devices’ and our“smart us
Alfonso Lievano
Alfonso Lievano  es un artista que trabaja con instalación y sonido, está principalmente interesado en generar piezas que propongan nuevas alternativas para dialogar acerca del presente. Su trabajo reflexiona sobre el uso de la tecnología y la información. Su obra ha sido expuesto en países como México, China, Thailandia, Hungría y Europa. A L también es fundador de una plataforma que dedicada al arte y a la música experimental
.
Fabiola Larios
Her work focuses on the culture of the Internet and the appropriation of moving images. Her work production focuses on: photography, digital collage, video art, videoperformance, gifs and live video mixing, using image and / or video manipulation techniques. She has been part of different biennials and exhibitions such as: Young Art, “Eject 5: International Videoperformance Festival” at Laboratorio Arte Alameda, and was selected in two pavilions at The Wrong – New Digital Art Biennale and ICONIC, the first cryptocurrency biennial. She has participated in the cyborgrrrls techofeminist meeting and was part of the Helloworld 2.0 Festival. This year she was selected for The Wrong in the Perfect Users pavilion and will have a live performance at the Teatro de las Artes en el Centro de las Artes in Mexico city
Moises Sanabria
Moises born in 1990, Caracas, Venezuela.
Moises404 is a meme-artist, creative technologist, and data scientist coding value through branding, contemporary art, math, and technology. He graduated from the Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art in 2015, is an alumnus of the School for Poetic Computation and at the School of Machines, Making, and Make-Believe. His current artistic strategy and discipline “Art Push-Ups & No-Budget Solutions” is to create every-day and harness attention into capital through post-produced algorithmic social media content in order to fully sustain his monumental physical art practice in the future.
Alonso Cedillo
The work of Alonso Cedillo (n.1988) is shaped through different media such as painting, sculpture,video, graphics and programming. His production explores the relationships we establish while connected to the internet, on a daily basis, through computers and mobile devices.
In 2006 he began his professional studies in painting with Gilberto Aceves Navarro, with whom he worked as an assistant from 2007 to 2009. At age 21 he began his studies at the National School of Painting, Sculpture and Printmaking, “La Esmeralda” where he focused on production and research with new media art. Since then, his work hinges the analog with the digital, understanding our reality as a real virtuality.
Emphasizing the economic and social aspects of the internet, his paintings and videos portray people who live from their online activity, virtual reality landscapes, cell phone photographs,computer-generated images, and leaked files. Understanding that the accumulation of information in the digital age is the greatest source of wealth, Cedillo portrays information displayed on screens, sculpts using computer-processed information, and uses the programming itself to make way for an awareness of how the internet shapes our daily life. Since 2012, he has focused on art theory and research. His work has been presented at the
Rita Vie
Rita Vie is a multimedia artist, currently working between venice and the internet. In her work, the artist often explores the nature of self-representation, from art history’s greatest masterpieces to today’s low resolution selfies.
William Wolfgang Wunderbar
William Wolfgang Wunderbar (aka #wiwowu) is a virtual entity that saw the light in 2016 and has since then collaborated with many digital artists and participated in numerous exhibitions around the globe.
He defines his way of working and making art as “joyfully mutating curiosity” and produces a wide variety of digital artworks and narratives. From gif’s, optical illusions, artist collectives to co-creative projects. Fascinated by analyzing societal patterns, distorting them or creating new ones.
Facebook: fb.me/lovehahawow
Instagram: @williamwolfgangwunderbar
Adrian Pickett
Adrian Pickett (b.1975) is a British visual artist and curator who, since 2014, has worked predominantly with digital forms of image making. Centering his practice in the context of social media based art groups, his work explores the possibilities of picture-making in the pixelated flow of online life
Carolina Villanueva Lucero
Carolina Villanueva Lucero
(Guaymas, Sonora, 1989)
Es licenciada por la Escuela Nacional de Pintura, Escultura y Grabado ENPEG “La Esmeralda”.
Ha recibido el apoyo en colectivo del Programa de Fomento a Proyectos y Coinversiones Culturales (2012); El apoyo FECAS, Jóvenes Creadores (2013)
. Participó en el proyecto “UAM tv” del CyAD de la UAM Azcapotzalco (2016). Desde 2016 es docente en “La Esmeralda” en el área de artes tecnológicas.
Ha participado en exposiciones colectivas dentro y fuera del país, en recintos privados y públicos como el Centro de Cultural Digital (2018) Mana Contemporary (2019); dos exposiciones individuales, en el Museo de Arte Carrillo Gil (2018) y en Salon Silicón (2019). Obtuvo el primer lugar de la Bienal de Arte Emergente de Nuevo León 2019.
Su trabajo se desarrolla a partir de la experimentación entorno a las posibilidades expresivas de la estética digital y las máquinas para hacer imágenes. Aborda temas como el paisaje y la mitología en las imágenes utilizando collage digital, imágenes en movimiento y trabajos en Internet principalmente.
[email protected]
www.carolinavillanuevalucero.net
Anastasiia Vladimirovna Zhilina
Anastasiia Vladimirovna Zhilina. Born in the Republic of Karelia, Russia, 1993. Bachelor of journalism (Saint-Petersburg, TV specification), master of visual culture (Moscow, dealing with glitch and video), postgraduate student of philosophy (Moscow, writing a dissertation about the technical and philosophy of technology). Picture and video maker. The interests: media theory, glitch theory, technology and technical objects, history of technology, science, environment, video and sound. Participated in Wrong Biennale (2016) from Perfect Users community. Email:
[email protected]
David Shane Smith
David Shane Smith is a songwriter and artist in Brooklyn, NY. Using lyricism, video, electronic composition and drawing, Smith explores community, alienation, celebration and isolation. His work is online and in person.
videagam.net
Kunal Agnihotri
I am a visual artist from Pune, India. Having studied graphic design, I have always been on the lookout for tools and techniques outside of the standard few that graphic designers are supposed to use. This has led me to employ a variety of techniques to corrupt and process images to make my art.technical and philosophy of technology). Picture and video maker. The interests: media theory, glitch theory, technology and technical objects, history of technology, science, environment, video and sound. Participated in Wrong Biennale (2016) from Perfect Users community. Email:
[email protected]
Sa Cha
Yvonne Libenson
#
Y
vonne
#
L
ibenson is an net art artist, Today, when technology seems utterly smooth and weightless—composed of invisible waves, wireless signals, abstract codes, e-trash explores the ways in which these systems are still stubbornly tied to the physical world She use the trash files from others people computers of other people to create her own expression. looks at the ways in which contemporary artists use—and misuse—tools and forms. The show features works made since the turn of the millennium that push and challenge the boundaries of technology: upending systems, experimenting with materials, and ultimately inventing novel techniques and substances.
Flavia Visconte
Flavia Visconte
is a Visual artist and Graphic designer.
In her artistic practice investigate the progress of the implementation of technology in life in general and the interaction with digital environment.
Some of her works were exhibited in different art spaces and galleries in Buenos Aires, New York and London.
She live and work in Buenos Aires.
contact us
[email protected]
Facebook
Instagram
145 E Flagler St,
Miami, FL 33131

Events
A talk with Tina La Porta
Tina reflored her work presented at the Whitney Museum of American Art
Translate { } Expression explores the relationship between technology, the body and female subjectivity– asking: what does it mean to be embodied in a high- tech world?
As I began working with the 3dimensional wire-frame model I started to question the ways in which human subjects interface with machines. The alienation experienced when the subject comes into direct contact with the
screen, the interface and the code is the affect of a displaced embodiment which resonates within the symbolic realm of cyberspace
A conversation with Doreen A. Rios
Doreen A. Ríos is an independent curator, chief curator of the Centre for Digital Culture in Mexico City and a lecturer of the M.A. in Visual Studies and B.A. in Digital Arts at Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México. Working with digital art and specialised in digital cultures and new media practices, Ríos’ curatorial practice focuses on hybrid materialities.She is also the founder of [ANTI]MATERIA, an online platform dedicated to the research and exhibition of Latin-American Digital Art. She has curated exhibitions in Mexico and the U.K. like My Wall is Your Filter Bubble (co-curated with Matthew Plummer-Fernandez), EMPTY VESSELS||VULNERABLE BODIES, Southampton: 2117, When removed from view, removed from existence, Archipiélago, fuera del círculo, and White into Green.
The event aims to combine digital art with live coding sessions, visual projection, music and live performance.We want to ask questions and try to answer them in this event. Is there force of gravity inside the digital space? What is the force that attracts the bodies to the screens? Is there a gravedad in the use of the internet?
bye bye devices was a farewell and transmutation ceremony of our electronic devices with which we have
We invited people to collaborate with those devices that are out of use or broken (cell phones, tablet, computers, cables) to be reused in a show during Miami Art Week.
The Museums Night Miami is a proposal  that meets large and small artistic projects of Miami all together,
to give more power & visibility to the artistic scene
contact us
[email protected]
Facebook
Instagram
145 E Flagler St,
Miami, FL 33131
